* Between 1922 and 1948, it was control under British Mandate, called Palestine - That is the name of this land when it was given to you by the British. * Before between 16th and 20th century it was under Ottoman Rule, it was called Kudus I-Sherif (Jerusalem), Nablus and Akka (Acre).* Between 13th and 16th century During the Mamluk Rule, it was called Falastin, as part of Bilad al-Sham (Syria-Palestine). * During the Crusade, it was referred to as the Kingdom of Jerusalem by the Western Christendom (the princes in communion with the a Roman Catholic Church). * During the Ummayad and Abbasid Rule between 7th and 12th century, the land was called Jund Filastin, with Gherussalaim (Jerusalem) as capital. Hence the Masjid Al Aqsa * 400 AD to 700 AD; During the Byzantine Rule; it was divided in three districts: Palaestina Prima, Palaestina Secunda, and Palaestina Salutaris. * During the Roman Rule, 70 AD - 400 AD, it was called Syria-Palaestina, with the capital in Antiochia. * During Herodian Rule, between 40 BC to 70 AD; It was a Tetrarchy of Judea, a client state of the Roman Empire.* During the Hasmonean’s rule (160 BC to 40 BC), it was called Judea & Samaria. * During the Greek Ptolemy and Seleucids Era (350 BC to 200 BC), it belonged to the Hellenistic Egypt and the Seleucid Persian interchangeably, the entire land was called Palaestina (it is a Greek name).* During the Assyrian, Babylonian and Achaemenid Persian rule (8th - 5th Century BC) - it was called Yehud Medinata.* After the myth of Exodus, and before Assyrian and Babylonian rules: It was called Kingdom of Judah and the (North) Kingdom of Israel in Samaria (hence the Samaritans Jews). The tribes of Israel were not yet Monotheistic; So nobody can claim Jewishness, or a Jewish Identity from this era. * Before 1000 BC; Canaan, belong to the Canaanites. Canaanites were the people whom Yahweh, the God of the Israelites, have asked to murder and pillage. Its capital was Jericho. * NOTE: Only for about less than 230 years the Jews could call this region as their country WITH Jewish Identity. As an Independent State during the Hasmonean rule, and as a Client State of the Roman Empire during Herodian Rule; Between 160 BC to 70 AD. The Roman and the Ashkenazi Jews were the only people who tried to expel the native of this land, in 70 AD and 1948, respectively. By contrast, upon conquering this region, the Achaemenid Persian (Iran), not only gave back this land to the Jews but also sponsoring the building of the Second Temple in 514 BC; because the Persian wants to built a “buffer zone” on the border with the advancing Greek.

The results of the firefight were posted on YouTube, try searching "israel Vs Islamic state" or something of that effect.In Israel: The only thing I know of is a 3 men strong attack in Jerusalem in 2017 I think, that ISIS took credit for, but other armed Palesinian groups claimed that they were lying and that it was them.In the West Bank:One of the only famous cases of the Palestinian Preventive Security actually functioning against terrorism was a case where they stopped an ISIS attack inside Israel, that was around 2018 if I recall.On the Egyptian front:This is where most of it is. Also shooting rockets at Eilat, although they were intercepted I think. There were other cross border raids since they became a thing, but I don't know which ones were necessarily theirs, like the ATGM attack in 2011.More importantly al-Sisi said in an interview that Israel bombed hundreds of ISIS targets with his approval in the Sinai around 2019-2018. There's a picture taken from a video from around the period of 2019 on an blog by Joe Truzman, where an ISIS member presents the munition dropped on them from the sky, surprise surprise, the inscription on it is in Hebrew.A few of the thwarted worldwide terrorism ISIS attacks were thanks to Israeli intelligence.
